intro: Cynoglossum paphlagonicum, commonly known as the Paphlagonian tongue grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, particularly Turkey and the Caucasus. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
